newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Preston leaps on Marlborough nickel find.
newsitem.headline: Preston leaps on Marlborough nickel find.

text.p: Shares in minerals explorer Preston Resources NL leapt more than 40 percent to an intraday high of A$1.40 on Thursday after well received drilling results from its Marlborough nickel project in central Queensland.

Preston said the results, released after trading closed on Thursday, showed all holes drilled within the resource zone displayed high grades of nickel mineralisation with 628 metres of the total 1367 metres being within mineralised material at a shallow depth.
"The results have come up as expected and people have been happy to jump in," said a Perth-based dealer.
"They are also consistent with what had previously come out when BHP did their drilling many years ago," he said.
Between 1964 and 1974, The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd and Inco Ltd established a resource of 38 million tonnes at 1.28 percent nickel.

The new holes were drilled within mineralised zones at Coorumburra West and Coorumburra East, which represented eight million tonnes at 1.3 percent nickel in the BHP resource inventory, Preston said in its drilling report.
By 3.00 p.m. (0500 GMT), Preston shares were off their highs but still up 30 cents at A$1.29 on turnover of 671,700 shares.
